fields.name: The Witcher
fields.about: The Witcher  is a 2007 action role-playing game developed by CD Projekt Red for Microsoft Windows and CD Projekt on OS X. It was based on the fantasy novel series The Witcher by Polish author Andrzej Sapkowski. The game's story takes place after the events of the main saga. It was released in 2007 to positive reviews from critics and received an aggregate score of 81/100 on Metacritic. In 2009, a console version, The Witcher: Rise of the White Wolf, was scheduled for release using an entirely new engine and combat system. This was suspended as a result of payment problems with console developers Widescreen Games. The first game has, to date, two sequels, namely The Witcher 2: Assassins of Kings in 2011 and The Witcher 3: Wild Hunt in 2015.

fields.name: Warcraft
fields.about: Warcraft is a franchise of video games, novels, and other media created by Blizzard Entertainment. The series is made up of five core games: Warcraft: Orcs & Humans, Warcraft II: Tides of Darkness, Warcraft III: Reign of Chaos, World of Warcraft, and Hearthstone. The first three of these core games are in the real-time strategy genre, where opposing players command virtual armies in battle against each other or a computer-controlled enemy. The fourth and best-selling title of the franchise is a massively multiplayer online role-playing game (MMORPG), where players control their character and interact with each other in a virtual world. Warcraft is one of the highest-grossing video game franchises of all time, having grossed $11.2 billion in lifetime revenue, as of 2018.

fields.name: The Elder Scrolls
fields.about:
The Elder Scrolls is a media franchise of action role-playing video games primarily developed by Bethesda Game Studios and published by Bethesda Softworks. The series focuses on free-form gameplay in an open world. Morrowind, Oblivion and Skyrim all won Game of the Year awards from multiple outlets. The series has sold more than 58 million copies worldwide.

Within the series' fictional universe, each game takes place on the continent of Tamriel. The setting combines pre-medieval real-world elements, such as a powerful Roman-like Empire, with high fantasy medieval themes, including limited technology, widespread magic use, and the existence of many mythological creatures. The continent is split into a number of provinces inhabited by humans and humanoid fantasy races such as elves, orcs and anthropomorphic animals. A common theme in the lore is that a chosen hero rises to defeat an incoming threat, usually a malevolent being or an antagonistic army.

fields.name: TENDER SHOVELTUSK STEAK
CHEERY CHERRY PIE
Dragonfire Chili
fields.ingredients:
1 lb ground beef
1 onion, chopped
3 cloves of garlic, minced
2 jalapeno peppers, diced
1 can of kidney beans, drained and rinsed
1 can of diced tomatoes
2 tbsp chili powder
1 tsp cumin
Salt and pepper to taste
fields.cooking_step:
In a large pot, brown the ground beef over medium heat. Drain excess fat.
Add the onion, garlic, and jalapeno peppers to the pot. Sauté until the onions are translucent.
Stir in the kidney beans, diced tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper.
Bring the chili to a simmer and let it cook for 30 minutes to an hour, stirring occasionally.
Adjust the seasoning if needed.
Serve hot

fields.name: Witcher's Potion Soup
fields.ingredients:
2 chicken breasts, diced
1 onion, chopped
2 carrots, sliced
2 celery stalks, sliced
3 cloves of garlic, minced
4 cups chicken broth
1 cup sliced mushrooms
1 cup spinach leaves
1 tsp dried thyme
Salt and pepper to taste
fields.cooking_step:
In a large pot, heat some oil and sauté the chicken until browned. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté the onion, carrots, celery, and garlic until softened.
Return the chicken to the pot and add the chicken broth, mushrooms, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 20 minutes.
Add the spinach leaves and cook for an additional 5 minutes until wilted.
Adjust the seasoning if needed.
Serve hot.

fields.name: Skyrim Sweet Rolls
fields.ingredients:
2 cups all-purpose flour
1/4 cup granulated sugar
1 tbsp baking powder
1/2 tsp salt
1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
2/3 cup milk
1 tsp vanilla extract
1/2 cup brown sugar
2 tsp ground cinnamon
1/2 cup powdered sugar
1-2 tbsp milk
fields.cooking_step:
Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, granulated sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Add the cold butter to the dry ingredients and use a pastry cutter or your fingers to cut it into the flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs.
In a separate bowl, combine the milk and vanilla extract. Pour the milk mixture into the flour mixture and stir until just combined.
Transfer the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead it a few times until it comes together. Roll it out into a rectangle.
In a small bowl, mix together the brown sugar and cinnamon. Sprinkle the mixture evenly over the dough.
Starting from one long side, tightly roll up the dough into a log. Slice the log into rolls, about 1 inch thick.
Place the rolls on the prepared baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.
While the rolls are baking, prepare the glaze by whisking together the powdered sugar and milk in a small bowl.
Remove the rolls from the oven and let them cool slightly. Drizzle the glaze over the warm rolls.
Serve and enjoy.

fields.name: Ironforge Braised Ribs
fields.ingredients:
2 lbs pork ribs
1 cup soy sauce
1/2 cup brown sugar
1/4 cup rice vinegar
4 cloves of garlic, minced
1 tbsp grated ginger
1 tsp black pepper
1/2 cup water
Green onions, chopped (for garnish)
fields.cooking_step:
Preheat the oven to 325°F (165°C).
In a bowl, whisk together the soy sauce, brown sugar, rice vinegar, garlic, ginger, black pepper, and water.
Place the ribs in a baking dish and pour the marinade over them, making sure they are fully coated.
Cover the dish with foil and bake for 2 to 2 1/2 hours, or until the ribs are tender and cooked through.
Remove the foil and broil the ribs for an additional 5 minutes to caramelize the sauce.
Garnish with chopped green onions and serve.

fields.name: Geralt's Witcher Soup
fields.ingredients:
1 lb beef stew meat, cubed
1 onion, chopped
2 carrots, sliced
2 potatoes, diced
2 parsnips, sliced
4 cups beef broth
1 cup diced tomatoes
2 cloves of garlic, minced
1 tsp dried thyme
Salt and pepper to taste
fields.cooking_step:
In a large pot, brown the beef stew meat over medium heat. Remove and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté the onion, carrots, potatoes, parsnips, and garlic until slightly softened.
Return the beef to the pot and add the beef broth, diced tomatoes, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Bring the soup to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 1 hour or until the beef is tender.
Adjust the seasoning if needed.
Serve hot

fields.name: Elsweyr Mango Tango Salad
fields.ingredients:
2 ripe mangoes, diced
1 red bell pepper, diced
1/2 red onion, thinly sliced
1/4 cup chopped fresh cilantro
2 tbsp lime juice
1 tbsp olive oil
Salt and pepper to taste
fields.cooking_step:
In a large bowl, combine the diced mangoes, red bell pepper, red onion, and cilantro.
In a small bowl, whisk together the lime juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.
Pour the dressing over the mango mixture and toss until well coated.
Let the salad sit for about 10 minutes to allow the flavors to meld.
Serve chilled.

fields.name: Dwarven Ale-Battered Fish
fields.ingredients:
1 lb white fish fillets
1 cup all-purpose flour
1/2 cup cornstarch
1 tsp baking powder
1 cup Dwarven ale (or any beer of your choice)
Salt and pepper to taste
Vegetable oil (for frying)
fields.cooking_step:
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, cornstarch, baking powder, salt, and pepper.
Gradually pour in the Dwarven ale while whisking until you have a smooth batter.
Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 375°F (190°C).
Dip each fish fillet into the batter, allowing any excess to drip off, and carefully place it into the hot oil.
Fry the fish for 3-4 minutes on each side, or until golden brown and crispy.
Remove the fish from the oil and drain on a paper towel-lined plate.
Serve hot with tartar sauce or your favorite dipping sauce.

fields.name: Roasted Venison with Blackberry Sauce
fields.ingredients:
2 lbs venison roast
1 tbsp olive oil
1 tsp dried rosemary
1 tsp dried thyme
Salt and pepper to taste
1 cup blackberries
1/4 cup red wine
2 tbsp honey
1 tbsp balsamic vinegar
fields.cooking_step:
Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C).
Rub the venison roast with olive oil, dried rosemary, dried thyme, salt, and pepper.
Place the roast on a rack in a roasting pan and cook in the preheated oven for about 25-30 minutes per pound, or until the internal temperature reaches your desired doneness.
In a saucepan, combine the blackberries, red wine, honey, and balsamic vinegar. Bring the mixture to a simmer and cook for about 10 minutes, or until the blackberries have broken down and the sauce has thickened.
Remove the roast from the oven and let it rest for 10 minutes before slicing.
Serve the sliced venison with the blackberry sauce.

fields.name: Hearthglen Roast Chicken
fields.ingredients:
1 whole chicken
4 cloves of garlic, minced
2 tbsp fresh rosemary, chopped
2 tbsp fresh thyme, chopped
1 lemon, sliced
Salt and pepper to taste
Olive oil
fields.cooking_step:
Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C).
Rinse the chicken and pat it dry with paper towels.
In a small bowl, combine the minced garlic, rosemary, thyme, salt, and pepper.
Rub the chicken with olive oil, then sprinkle the herb mixture all over the chicken, including inside the cavity.
Stuff the chicken cavity with the lemon slices.
Place the chicken on a roasting pan and roast in the preheated oven for about 1 hour and 15 minutes, or until the internal temperature reaches 165°F (74°C).
Let the chicken rest for 10 minutes before carving.
Serve hot

fields.name: Temerian Beef Stew
fields.ingredients:
2 lbs beef stew meat, cubed
2 tbsp vegetable oil
1 onion, chopped
2 carrots, sliced
2 parsnips, sliced
3 potatoes, diced
2 cloves of garlic, minced
4 cups beef broth
1 cup red wine
2 tbsp tomato paste
1 tsp dried thyme
Salt and pepper to taste
fields.cooking_step:
In a large pot, heat the vegetable oil over medium-high heat. Add the beef stew meat and brown it on all sides. Remove the meat from the pot and set aside.
In the same pot, sauté the onion, carrots, parsnips, and garlic until they begin to soften.
Return the beef to the pot and add the beef broth, red wine, tomato paste, dried thyme, salt, and pepper.
Bring the stew to a boil, then reduce the heat to low, cover the pot, and let it simmer for 2-3 hours, or until the beef is tender.
Adjust the seasoning if needed.
Serve hot.

fields.name: Skooma-infused Sweetrolls
fields.ingredients:
2 cups all-purpose flour
1/4 cup granulated sugar
1 tbsp baking powder
1/2 tsp salt
1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
2/3 cup milk
1 tsp vanilla extract
1/2 cup brown sugar
2 tsp ground cinnamon
1/4 cup Skooma (or orange juice for a non-alcoholic version)
Glaze: 1 cup powdered sugar, 2 tbsp milk
fields.cooking_step:
Preheat the oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper.
In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, granulated sugar, baking powder, and salt.
Add the cold, cubed butter to the flour mixture. Use a pastry cutter or your fingers to cut it into the flour mixture until it resembles coarse crumbs.
In a separate bowl, combine the milk and vanilla extract. Pour the milk mixture into the flour mixture and stir until just combined.
Transfer the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead it a few times until it comes together. Roll it out into a rectangle.
In a small bowl, mix together the brown sugar and cinnamon. Sprinkle the mixture evenly over the dough.
Starting from one long side, tightly roll up the dough into a log. Slice the log into rolls, about 1 inch thick.
Place the rolls on the prepared baking sheet and bake for 12-15 minutes or until golden brown.
While the rolls are baking, prepare the glaze by whisking together the powdered sugar and milk in a small bowl.
Remove the rolls from the oven and let them cool slightly. Drizzle the glaze over the warm rolls.
Serve and enjoy.

fields.name: Whiterun Honey-Glazed Carrots
fields.ingredients:
1 lb carrots, peeled and sliced
2 tbsp unsalted butter
2 tbsp honey
1 tsp dried thyme
Salt and pepper to taste
Chopped fresh parsley (for garnish)
fields.cooking_step:
In a large skillet, melt the butter over medium heat.
Add the carrots to the skillet and sauté for about 5 minutes, until they begin to soften.
Drizzle the honey over the carrots and sprinkle with dried thyme, salt, and pepper. Stir to coat the carrots evenly.
Reduce the heat to low and cover the skillet. Cook for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the carrots are tender.
Remove from heat and garnish with chopped fresh parsley.
Serve hot.

fields.name: Stormwind Mead
fields.ingredients:
4 cups honey
1 liter water
1 lemon, sliced
1 orange, sliced
2 tablespoons fresh lime juice
1 tablespoon fresh lemon juice
1 cup white rum (optional)
fields.cooking_step:
In a large pot, combine the honey and water. Bring to a simmer and stir until the honey is completely dissolved.
Add the sliced lemon, orange, fresh lime juice, and fresh lemon juice.
Remove the pot from heat and add the white rum (optional) if you want an alcoholic version.
Let the mixture steep for about 30 minutes to allow the flavors to blend.
Chill the mead in the refrigerator or serve over ice.
Serve chilled

fields.name: Swallow Potion
fields.ingredients:
1 1/2 ounces high-quality vodka
1 ounce grain alcohol
1/2 ounce herbal liqueur
1/2 ounce hazelnut liqueur
1/2 ounce lemon juice
1/2 ounce cherry syrup
Ice for chilling
fields.cooking_step:
In a shaker filled with ice, combine all the ingredients.
Shake vigorously to mix well.
Strain the potion into a glass.
Serve chilled.

fields.name: Scooma
fields.ingredients:
1 cup sugar
1 cup water
1 tablespoon honey
1 tablespoon lemon juice
1 teaspoon almond extract
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
1/4 teaspoon ground cardamom
Ice for serving
fields.cooking_step:
In a small saucepan, combine the sugar, water, honey, lemon juice, almond extract, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, ground cloves, and ground cardamom.
Bring the mixture to a boil, stirring until the sugar is fully dissolved.
Remove from heat and let the skooma syrup cool to room temperature.
To serve, fill a glass with ice and pour the skooma syrup over it.
Stir well and enjoy.
Serve over ice.
